abstract.para: This guide is intended to provide you with simple instructions on how to install Shinken on windows and have it monitoring your local machine inside of 20 minutes. No advanced installation options are discussed here - just the basics that will work for 95% of users who want to get started.
These instructions were written based on a standard Windows (tested on 2k3, 2k8, XP and Seven).

section.title: What You'll End Up With
section.para: If you follow these instructions, here's what you'll end up with:

listitem.para: Shinken and the plugins will be installed underneath c:\shinken\
Shinken will be configured to monitor a few aspects of your local system (CPU load, disk usage, etc.)

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: During portions of the installation you'll need to have administrator access to your machine.
Make sure you've installed the following packages on your Windows installation before continuing.

section.title: Download Shinken and the Plugins
section.para: Take the Shinken pakage Here and uncomrpess it in c: so you will have directory as c:\shinken. Take the files instsrv.exe, srvany.exe and sc.exe from the directory of the ressource kit (typically c:\program files\Windows Resource Kits\Tools) and put them in the directory c:\shinken\windows.

section.title: Install Shinken as a Service
section.para: Launch the batch c:\shinken\windows\install-all.bat to declare all services need by Shinken :
Then double click in all reg file in the directory (one for each service) so service parameters will be correcly populated. You can then launch services.msc to see you brand new services.
But don't start Shinken yet - there's still more that needs to be done…

section.title: Customize Configuration
section.para: Sample configuration files have now been installed in the c:\shinken\etc directory. These sample files should work fine for getting started with Shinken. You'll need to make just one change before you proceed...

Edit the c:\shinken\etc\contacts.cfg config file with your favorite editor and change the email address associated with the shinkenadmin contact definition to the address you'd like to use for receiving alerts.

section.title: Compile and Install the Nagios Plugins
Start Shinken
section.para: The only thing you need is to start all Shinken services.

section.title: Other Modifications
section.para: Configuring email notifications is out of the scope of this documentation. While Shinken is currently configured to send you email notifications, your system may not yet have a mail program properly installed or configured. Refer to your system documentation, search the web, or look to the NagiosCommunity.org wiki for specific instructions on configuring your system to send email messages to external addresses. More information on notifications can be found here.

section.title: You're Done
section.para: Congratulations! You sucessfully installed Shinken. Your journey into monitoring is just beginning. You'll no doubt want to monitor more than just your local machine, so check out the following docs...
